results.title: Renewable energy in Australia
results.creator_credit: Philip Robertson, Michael Rubetzki and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The film presents a range of alternatives to conventional energy sources for small-scale power requirements. Surveys the systems and technology currently available in Australia including wind, mini-hydro, biomass and photovoltaic systems.

results.title: Are girls calculating?
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: This videotape can be used not only in the maths-science classroom to encourage girls to see the importance of maths, but also as a valuable resource for careers teachers, and for social science units on either the workforce or sexism in society.

results.title: Northern oasis
results.creator_credit: E.M. Jackson and Boort Progress Association
results.brief_description:
A silent film about life in the North-Western Victorian country town of Boort during the 1940s. Produced by and for the people of Boort and district.
The Loddon Weir is shown, as are: local livestock sales, dairy, poultry, pork and citrus farming, school children at the small local school and Australia Day celebrations with athletics, a fashion parade, tennis, lawn bowls and decorative boat river regatta. The film ends with the “Water - the life-blood of the North. The future progress and prosperity of this Northern-Oasis depend upon its assured supply.”

results.title: The Teacher and the Computer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Computers”.
Teacher, Anne McDougall, talks about the introduction of computers into education and the relationship of the teacher and the computer, a paper presented to the Junior World Computer Congress, Melbourne, October 16-18, 1980.

results.title: Advance Australia
results.creator_credit: Dept of the Interior and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: An interpretation of the Australian way of life, set against a background showing phases of Australia’s land, cities, natural resources, primary and secondary industries, arts, sports, recreations, and potentialities. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: What's in a Name

results.title: Printer light play
results.brief_description: A study on the technical properties of film colour. Shot on Eastman colour negative, the film records a variety of combinations of the printer lights, blue, red and green, thus creating different colour effects with the subject, a boy holding a Kodak colour control card.

results.title: Experiments in three colour separation
results.brief_description: A documentary of the work of Arthur and Corinne Cantrill since 1975 in 3-colour separation. Discusses the classic theories and principles in 3-colour separation in film and photography. Commentary by Arthur Cantrill.

results.title: The Squat
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place of Your Own”.
The tape looks at the predicament of the growing number of young people who are homeless. Three people live in a refuge for a time and then decide to occupy, and renovate an abandoned house nearby
